alert.note: Alert for Juneau Borough and Northern Admiralty Island (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 08 at 12:07AM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR A GLACIER-DAMMED LAKE OUTBURST REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 AM AKDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by a glacier-dammed lake outburst continues. * WHERE...The following area, Mendenhall Lake and River areas. * WHEN...Until 1145 AM AKDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...The lake and river may rise out of their banks and flow across roads. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1201 AM AKDT, USGS web camera images of Suicide Basin indicate that the basin continues to release. Water will continue to drain through Saturday. - Areas around the glacier visitor center, the Mendenhall campground, Skaters Cabin Road, View Drive and possibly below Back Loop bridge is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. - For Mendenhall Lake : At 11:15pm the stage was 7.35 feet. Flood Stage is 9.0 feet. Forecast: A crest around 9.0 feet is expected around 10:00am Friday. Impacts: At 6.7 feet: Nugget Falls trail begins to flood near the "causeway" at the end of the trail. At 7.7 feet: Nugget Falls trail begins to flood near the beginning of the trail At 9.0 feet: Water covers Skaters Cabin Road between Skaters Cabin and West Glacier Trailhead, also water will flow into the Mendenhall Lake Campground. Inherent uncertainty in initial glacier lake volume will result in varying crest height and timing. - Inherent uncertainty in initial glacier lake volume will result in varying crest height and timing. - If you live near or along the Mendenhall Lake and River stay alert and be prepared to take action.
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information.

area.areaDesc: Juneau Borough and Northern Admiralty Island
